meanings.definition: To surpass in shaming or embarrassing someone.
meanings.sent1: She outshamed her friend by revealing a secret in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outshame others with his hurtful comments.
meanings.sent3: The competition turned into an outshaming battle of insults.
meanings.sent4: Her bright smile outshamed the gloomy weather.
meanings.sent5: The student's achievement outshamed all expectations.

meanings.definition: The act of causing someone to feel shame or embarrassment in a public or noticeable way.
meanings.sent1: Public outshaming can have a lasting impact on a person's self-esteem.
meanings.sent2: The outshaming of the celebrity spread quickly on social media.
meanings.sent3: The outshaming incident at the party became the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The outshaming of the politician was seen as a warning to others.
meanings.sent5: The outshaming of the student was unintentional but still hurtful.
